A plant, also known as a green plant or vascular plant, is a living organism of the kingdom Plantae. It is characterised by body cells with cell walls containing cellulose, and a life cycle that involves alternation of generations between a haploid gametophyte and a diploid sporophyte.
The most common plants are trees, shrubs, herbaceous plants, and ferns.

The Wii Remote, also known colloquially as the Wiimote, is the primary controller for Nintendo's Wii console. An essential capability of the Wii Remote is its motion sensing capability, which allows the user to interact with and manipulate items on screen via gesture recognition and pointing, using accelerometer and optical sensor technology.

A tree is a perennial plant with an elongated stem, or trunk, supporting branches and leaves in most species. In some usages, the definition of a tree may be narrower, including only woody plants with secondary growth, plants that are usable as lumber or plants above a specified height.
